newsitem.title: CUBA: Nation of Islam's Farrakhan meets Castro.
newsitem.headline: Nation of Islam's Farrakhan meets Castro.

text.p: Louis Farrakhan, leader of the U.S.-based Nation of Islam who recently travelled to Libya for a prize, met with Cuban President Fidel Castro, state media said on Wednesday.

The black American leader and Castro discussed world affairs, the situation in Cuba and the U.S. African American community. The meeting took place a few hours after the Nation of Islam leader arrived in Cuba on Tuesday, accompanied by members of his family and other members of the organisation.

Farrakhan told Cuban reporters he was interested in obtaining a close view of the impact of recently tightened U.S. economic sanctions against Cuba. He was due to leave the communist-ruled island later on Wednesday.

Farrakhan was recently awarded a $250,000 human rights prize in Libya, which is on the U.S. list of states that it says sponsor international terrorism. The U.S. Treasury Department denied his application to receive the $250,000 award or a $1 billion gift Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi had pledged to the Nation of Islam after they met last January.
Farrakhan organised last October's Million Man March that brought thousands of black men to Washington for a peaceful rally.
